bill_title: revise provisions regarding state-owned motor vehicles.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise provisions regarding state-owned motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 5-25 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Each office, department, institution, board, and agency of this state shall maintain and operate any state-owned passenger motor vehicle for at least ten years or until the vehicle reaches a mileage of at least one hundred and seventy-five thousand miles, before the vehicle may be removed from operation. However, if the vehicle is damaged and the cost to repair would be greater than the value of the vehicle, the motor vehicle may be removed from service. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Withdrawn at the Request of the Prime Sponsor
